alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 05 at 2:41AM MDT until April 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Guadalupe County, Espanola Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, Upper Rio Grande Valley, Far Northeast Highlands and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing dust will reduce visibility on area roadways.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley
